intro: Jacaranda campinae, commonly known as the African jacaranda, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The tree has a straight trunk with smooth, grey bark and produces long, pendulous clusters of flowers. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of many small, oval leaflets, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant is adapted to dry climates and is commonly found in savanna and woodland habitats.
